H0.text: What main category of machines 'produce continuous power from a wheel/rotor, usually with vanes, revolved by fast flowing fluid'. Pump

H1.text: What main category of machines 'produce continuous power from a wheel/rotor, usually with vanes, revolved by fast flowing fluid'. Fan

H2.text: What main category of machines 'produce continuous power from a wheel/rotor, usually with vanes, revolved by fast flowing fluid'. Propeller

H3.text: What main category of machines 'produce continuous power from a wheel/rotor, usually with vanes, revolved by fast flowing fluid'. Turbine

A4.text: A turbine is a rotary mechanical device that extracts energy from a fluid flow and converts it into useful work.

A5.text: A turbine is a turbomachine with at least one moving part called a rotor assembly, which is a shaft or drum with blades attached.
